item.title: UI components library (Chapter II): Components anatomy and interfaces
item.description:
This is the second post of a series about why and how to create a UI components library. I’m going to focus on the code examples in Vue.js, but the concepts are valid for any other framework like React, Angular, LitElements, etc.

Chapter I: Introduction

Before creating a components library, it’s important to understand the anatomy of a component, its interfaces, and how to create a good “API” for the components.

item.title: UI components library (Chapter I): Why and to create one? Characteristics of a good UI library
item.description: This is the first post of a series about why and how to create a UI components library. I’m going to focus on the code examples in Vue.js, but the concepts are valid for any other framework like React, Angular, LitElements, etc. In this first post I’m going to talk about the component of why you should (or should not) create a UI components library, but first let’s define what is a UI components library.

item.title: Talk: Creating your own Vue UI components library: From scratch to NPM
item.description:
Past September 29th I did a talk about how to create your own Vue UI components.

I explained some tips about how to organize the components’ code, talked in deep about how to set the values in package.json and their meaning. And how to publish on NPM and then how to use them in another project.

The talk was in Spanish, but slides are in English.
